Speak with your health care provider, or contact the mpox Hotline: 1-800-889-3931Over-the-counter medications (e.g., acetaminophen, NSAIDs) are recommended for general pain control for patients with mpox. Topical steroids and anesthetics such as lidocaine can be considered for local pain relief. Topical lidocaine or other topical anesthetics should be used with caution on broken skin or open or draining wounds. Use disposable gloves when applying topical medications to lesions, then dispose of the gloves and practice hand hygiene. Prescription pain medications (i.e., gabapentin, opioids*) have been used for short-term management of severe pain not controlled with other treatments listed above. *Opioids may increase risk for side effects such as constipation, or long-term consequences use such as opioid use disorder or overdose.
